sentences.english: To be occupied in what does not concern you is worse than doing nothing.
sentences.chinese: 忙活一些與己無關的事，甚至比無所事事還要糟糕。

sentences.english: The night waned , and I worked hastily, but in silence.
sentences.chinese: 夜色闌珊，我麻利地忙活着，當然是悄無聲息。

sentences.english: GRACE is already inside,starting the GENNY.
sentences.chinese: 而Grace已經在裏面開始忙活了。

sentences.english: Several workers were busy under the bridge lower than the ground.
sentences.chinese: 幾個老哥在低於地面的橋下忙活着。

sentences.english: Get your outside accountants going NOW.
sentences.chinese: 外聘的會計師事務所現在就可以忙活起來了。

sentences.english: She’s going to be busy for 20 years.
sentences.chinese: 她將要忙活20年纔會得空。

sentences.english: They are busying themselves (in) packing up.
sentences.chinese: 他們正忙活着整理行裝。

sentences.english: Surely this would keep the child busy for hours, he thought.
sentences.chinese: 他確信這能讓他的兒子忙活上幾個小時。

sentences.english: While he's busy setting things up, you have time with Bianca .
sentences.chinese: 當他在忙活這事情的時候，你就有時間去泡比安卡。

definition: to take care of/to raise money/to attend to (guests, customers etc)
erhua variant of 幹活|干活[gan4 huo2]
to clear up/to tidy up/to pick up/to repair
to fiddle with sth/to trade with sth
in a busy and hasty manner
to act in a supporting role/fig. to play second fiddle
to rush/in a hurry/to worry about being late
to stop work for the day (generally of laborers)/to knock off
